bibl.title: ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, BY-LAWS, AND ORDER OF BUSINESS of the NEBRASKA STATE POULTRY ASSOCIATION

respStmt.name: OCLC Online Computer Library Center Inc.

p.seg: BY-LAWS, AND ORDER OF BUSINESS of the NEBRASKA STATE POULTRY ASSOCIATION Incorporated September 26, 1892. ta copy of the act of the Legislature granting aid to the Assot and legalizing the same as a State Institution. ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION. The State of Nebraska, i tKnow all men by these presents, That we, C. M. Lcwelling, Geo. W. rhout, John R. Megahan, Irving L. Lytnan, J. M. Armstrong, F. G. :, and Albert Lemen have associated ourselves together, and by these ;nts do associate ourselves together, for the purpose of forming and be - ing a corporation in the state of Nebraska, and do hereby adopt the wing ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION Article i . The name of such incorporation shall be the Nebraska State Poultry Association. Art. 2. The principal place of transacting its business shall be in the city of Lincoln, county of Lancaster, state of Nebraska. Art. 3. The nature of the business to be transacted by said corporation shall be the encouragement of the interests and promotion of improvements in the breeding and management of poultry, by means of exhibit! or the collection an 1 dissemination of reliable and practical information rela - tive to the utility breeds of poultry. I Art. 4. Tae amount of capital stock, authorized, of said association > be two tho isand (2,000) dollars, which shall be divided into four hun (400) share of five (5) dollars each. Fifty per cent of each share of c shall be p id in cash at the time of issuing a certificate for the same, the fifty pe :ent remaining unpaid shall be due at the call of the board irectors, at ny time after six months from date of certificate. Art. 5. Eich share of stock shall entitle the owner thereof to one vote Vss. Lancaster County. )

2 stock shall be owned by any one person. I Art. 6. The shares of any stockholder who shall neglect or refuse to into the treasury of this association such installments or sums of money thereon as may be called for by the board of directors as herein pro - d, within thirty days after notice of such call, shall, if the boar. ars so direct, be declared forfeited, and the same shall thereupon be for - d to the associal ; KRT. 7. The existence of this corporation shall commence September )2, and continue twei -ars from said date, unless soon* , or continued in accordance with law. I Art. 8. The amount of ability or indebtedness to which this corpora - is at any time to subject itself is hereby limited to fifty ( 50) per cent of aid up capital stock. Art. 9. The officers of this corporation shall consist of a President, Vice-President, Secretary, Treasurer, and Board of Directors. The Board of Directors shall consist of nine (g) members of the association, to-wit: the ent, Vice-President, Secretary, Treasurer, and five (5) others. The officers shall be elected by a majority vote, by ballot at the annual meeting of the stockholders, and shall serve one year, or until their successors have been elected and qualified. Vacancies in office occuring during the term, removal, or death of any of the above mentioned officers, shall be filled by the Board of Directors. L'ntil a regular election of officers the respective officers shall be as follows, to wit: President, C. M. hew Vice-President, Geo. \V. Osterhout; Secretary, John R. Megahan; Trea Wm. A. Armstrong; Board of Directors, C. M. Jewelling, Geo. \V John R. Megahan. Wm. A. Armstrong. B. C. Blowers, S. S. Borton, I. L. Lj'mau. H. R. C. Montgomery, and W. C. Brown. Art. 10. The business of this corporation shall be conducted in ac - cordance with the by-laws adopted by the corporation. In testimony whereof, we have hereunto set our hands this 25th da October, A. D. 1892 C. ML Lewei.i.' John R. Megahan, Irving L. Lyman, J. M. ARMSTR' ' F. G. Albert Li In presence of L. Meyer r State of Nebraska. ) Vss. caster County. ) On this 25th day of October, A D

3 r said counVy, personally came C. M. Lewelling, Geo. W. Osterhout, John R. Megahan, Irving L. Lyman, J. M. Armstrong, P. G. Yule, Albert Lemen, personally to ine known to be the identical persons whose name* are affixed to the above instrument as their act and nowledged the execution as their own free will and deed. Witness my hand and notarial seal at my office the day and year above [seal] L. Meyer, State oe Nebk Secretary's Office Received and filed for record this 15th day .her, A. D. i8<,. recorded in book "L," Miscellaneous Incorporations, at page 455. BY-LAWS [Adopted by the Board of Directors, February 21, i Article 1. The President shall preside at all meetings, sign all war- upon the treasury, cast the deciding vote in case of a tie, call extra f the Board of Directors when requested in writing by five e members of the ass ful funct presiding officer of a deliberative b. Art. 2. The Vice- President shall perform all duties incident I office of President in the absence of the regular presiding officer. Art. 3. The Secretary shall conduct the general correspondence association, and have custody of the same, sha'l preserve all important let - ters received and a copy of the answer thereto, to be read at the met - the association, if requested, and keep the minutes of the Board of Directors; keep an account of all the expenses incurred by the correspon shall keep the minutes of the meetings of the stockholders of the assoc: and have charge of all the books and papers appertaining to his office shall also issue certificates of stock in the association , and shall have his books and papers open at all times for inspection of the Board of Dir and shall receive for all such services the sum of one hundr - per annum; said sum shall include clerical assistance; and give a bt the sum of one thousand ( 1,000) dollars, to be approved by the Board. Art. 4. The Treasurer shall have charge of all funds belonging to the association and pay all bills per order of the President. by the Secretary, as long as the association funds hold in hand. He shall keep his accounts in proper form for the inspection of the Board of Directors and shall give a bond to the President in the sum of two thousand ( 2,00 : CERS.

4 lars. to be approved by the Board of Directors. He shall also make a report at the annual meeting of all the receipts and expenditures for the current year, and shall collect all moneys and assets due the association, keeping a correct account thereof, and shall receive for all services a salary of twenty - five dollars per annum. Art. 5. The Board of Directors will hold Special meetings at the call of five ( 5 ) or more of its members, five 15) of whom shall constitute a quorum. It shall control the affairs of the association at all times except when the stock holders are in session, attend to all printing, giving pub - licity to and secure suitable accommodation for all public exhibitions, appoint all judges; also provide suitable medals, diplomas, and such other awards as are advisable, and report its transactions at any meeting of the association. ANNUAL EXHIBIT Art. 6. The annual exhibit of the association shall be held in January of each year, beginning with the third Tuesday, on which day the annual meeting of the stockholders shall begin and continue in convention until the business of the association shall be concluded. The annual election of officers shall be held on Thursday evening of the same week, begining at 8 o'clock P. m. and said officers shall assume their respective duties on Fri - day next succeeding the annual meeting, when the Board of Directors shall meet, and all reports be audited, and accounts settled. All officers of this association shall hold their respective offices for one ( 1 ) year and until their successors are elected and inducted into office. SEMI-ANNUAL MEETING. art. 7. The semi-annual meeting of this association shall be held on Thursday of the week of the State Fair, on the Fair grounds. HOW AMENDED Art. 8. These by-laws may be amended by a majority vote of the stockholders when in regular convention. BOARD OF MANAGERS Art. 9. The Board of Directors shall also be the Board of Managers ORDER OF BUSINESS. Art. 10. Order of Business. — First, call to order; second, roll call; third, reading minutes of previous meeting; fourth, unfinished business; fifth, reports of officers: sixth, reports of special and other committees; seventh, communications and correspondence; eighth new business; ninth,

5 r LEGISLATIVE ACT LEGALIZING THE NEBRASKA STATE POULTRY ASSOCIATION HOUSE ROLL NO. 388. r for an act legalizing the Nebraska State Poultry Association; to de - fine certain duties of said association; to make an annual appropria - tion therefor, and fixing a penalty fur the misappropriation of any of the money hereby granted. [Introduced by Mr. Casper, of Butler.] Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Nebraska: K Section i. That the regularly organized and incorporated society ,vn as the Nebraska State Poultry Association, whose articles of incor - tion are recorded in the office of the secretary of state, be and the same :reby legalized as a state institution. tSEC. 2. The Nebraska State Poultry Association shall hold a convention lally, on the third Tuesday in January, at such place in the state as the d of managers may select, for the purpose of gathering statistics and ising practical knowledge on subjects pertaining to the poultry interests le state, by addresses, papers, discussions, and such other means as the "d of managers may direct. I Sec. 3. The Secretary of said association shall preserve all papers read, take a stenographic report of all addresses and discussions at said an- I convention, and shall make a report of the same to the governor, to - ler with a full report of all business transacted, including an itemized ■merit of all expenditures of money, and shall publish in pamphlet form less than two thousand copies of said report, which shall be distributed irding to the laws governing the distribution of the reports of the e Board of Agriculture. SEC. 4. The sum of $1,000 is hereby annually appropriated out of any moneys in the state treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the use and benefit of said association, and the state auditor is hereby authorized to draw his warrant for the same upon presentation of proper vouchers therefor certified to by the President and Secretary of said association, said amount to be used only for defraying the expenses incurred in holding conventions, and in publishing and distributing reports and such other purposes as in the discretion of the board of managers shall best subserve the poultry in - terests of the state. I Sec. 5. If any officer or member of said association shall convert an v le moneys herein appropriated to his own use, or suffer the same to be or expended in any other way or manner or for any other purpose than signated by law, such officer or member shall be deemed guilty of em - lement, and upon conviction thereof shall be punished by imprisonment le penitentiary not less than one nor more than three years.
